cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving NNE across the eastern Gulf, forecast to cross Florida’s Big Bend tonight, then accelerate northeast along/just offshore the Southeast U.S. coast and out over the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Apalachicola

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect north of South Santee River SC at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL (Gulf side) and Sebastian Inlet FL to South Santee River SC (Atlantic side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of FL this evening, then Atlantic coast from FL through the Carolinas Tuesday–Wednesday
weather_observation.wind: A short period of gusty east to northeast winds (occasionally reaching tropical-storm force) is possible Tuesday night into early Wednesday; overall likelihood remains low (~3%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding or elevated surf possible; significant surge (>3 ft) not expected for Hampton Roads.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible as the storm passes offshore, causing brief ponding and minor drainage issues.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Virginia Beach; brief, isolated tornado cannot be ruled out south of the port but probability is very low.
